title: The Butcher Came and Slew the Ox
medium: hand-painted collage with lithograph, linoleum and silkscreen
provenance_text:
Frank Stella [1936-]; Waddington Graphics, London, England, November 1984 [1]; purchased by Mr. and Mrs. Edward Haskell [1920-1988], Pittsburgh, PA, November 23, 1984 until June 23, 1988 [2]; Jane (Mrs. Edward) Haskell [1923-2013], June 23, 1988 until May 28, 2013; partial gift to Carnegie Museum of Art, Pittsburgh, PA, December 1993, December 2005, and remainder bequest in September 2013. 

Notes:
[1]. This is copy no. 27 of an edition of 60; see correspondence with Waddington Graphics in curatorial file.
[2]. The invoice from the gallery is for the pre-publication price (£12,000) less 10% discount, i.e., £10,800.
